1.name: Cleopatra
1.description: The story of Cleopatra, the fabulous queen of Egypt, and the epic romances between her and the greatest men of Rome, Julius Caesar and Antony.

2.name: The Little Princess
2.description: Little Sara Crewe is placed in a boarding school by her father when he goes off to war, but he does not understand that the headmistress is a cruel, spiteful woman who makes life miserable ...                See full summary »

3.name: The Poor Little Rich Girl
3.description: The wealthy but selfish parents of a lonely young girl begin to rethink what is important to them after a servant's irresponsibility results in a crisis.

4.name: Terje Vigen
4.description: Terje Vigen, a sailor, suffers the loss of his family through the cruelty of another man. Years later, when his enemy's family finds itself dependent on Terje's beneficence, Terje must ...                See full summary »

5.name: Der Golem und die Tänzerin
5.description: As a practical joke, an actor impersonates the screen monster he made famous. Complications ensue.

6.name: The Little American
6.description: A young American has her ship torpedoed by a German U-boat but makes it back to ancestral home in France, where she witnesses German brutality firsthand.

7.name: Seven Keys to Baldpate
7.description: A writer bets a friend that he can write a 10,000-word novel in 24 hours. The friends takes the bet, and gives him the keys to his Baldpate Inn, which has been closed for the winter, so he ...                See full summary »

8.name: Betsy Ross
8.description: Revolutionary War heroine Betsy Ross finds herself in competition with her sister for the affections of a British soldier.

9.name: A Mormon Maid
9.description: This silent melodrama is set against the 1840s westward migration of the Mormons. Dora, a young woman, and her family are saved from an Indian attack by a Mormon community traveling to Utah...                See full summary »

11.name: On Dangerous Ground
11.description: Bradford Stewart, a young American surgeon studying in Germany, is dining in Cologne with a German friend, Ritter Bloem, a philosopher and a patriotic German. The latter is called away by ...                See full summary »

12.name: Tösen från Stormyrtorpet
12.description: Helga is a young single lady who has a baby by a much older married man. After the older man tells Helga's father that he refuses to pay child support because he isn't the child's father, ...                See full summary »

13.name: Umirayushchiy lebed
13.description: A grief-stricken ballerina becomes the obsession of an increasingly unhinged artist.

14.name: The Secret Game
14.description: During the Great War, German and Japanese spies face off in the United States.

15.name: Les Misérables
15.description: Jean Valjean, a good and decent man who has committed a minor crime, is imprisoned but escapes. He is pursued thereafter for years by Javert, the cruel and implacable arm of the law.

16.description: A retired judge comes West to restore a ghost town.

17.name: Bucking Broadway
17.description: A ranch foreman battles a rich stockbroker for the affections of a beautiful young woman.

18.name: Tom Sawyer
18.description: Tom Sawyer, a young Missouri lad, finds fun and adventure with his pals Joe Harper and Huckleberry Finn, running away to hide out on Jackson's Island and pretending to be Mississippi River ...                See full summary »

19.name: The Black Stork
19.description: A young man and woman are considering marriage; eugenicist Harry J Haiselden warns that they are ill-matched and will produce defective offspring. He is right; their baby is born defective,...                See full summary »

20.name: Straight Shooting
20.description: Cattleman Flint cuts off farmer Sims' water supply. When Sims' son Ted goes for water, one of Flint's men kills him. Cheyenne is sent to finish off Sims, but finding the family at the newly dug grave, he changes sides.

21.name: Raffles, the Amateur Cracksman
21.description: Gentleman burglar Raffles tries to get his hand on a priceless pearl.

22.name: Polly of the Circus
22.description: When circus aerialist Polly Fisher is injured, she is taken to the nearby home of minister John Hartley. The two fall in love and marry secretly. But when the news leaks out, the minister ...                See full summary »

23.name: The Pride of the Clan
23.description: Among the simple fisher-folk of a little island off the west coast of Scotland lives MacTavish, head of a clan. Here he rules as a chieftain and his word is law. One day a hurricane sweeps ...                See full summary »

24.name: A Romance of the Redwoods
24.description: A young girl travels west to live with her uncle during the California Gold Rush only to find that he has been killed by Indians and his identity assumed by an outlaw.

26.name: The Scarlet Car
26.description: After discovering that Cyrus Peabody, the president of the bank, and his son Ernest have embezzled 35,000 dollars, their cashier, Paul Revere Forbes, threatens to expose them. In a rage, ...                See full summary »

27.name: El apóstol
27.description: Argentinian President Yrigoyen burns Buenos Aires using Jupiter's thunderbolts.

29.name: Camille
29.description: Camille is a courtesan in Paris. She falls deeply in love with a young man of promise, Armand Duval. When Armand's father begs her not to ruin his hopes of a career and position by marrying...                See full summary »

30.name: Broadway Jones
30.description: An arrogant young man leaves his Ohio home to make it big on Broadway in New York City when he inherits the family business and $1-million. However, things don't go quite according to his ...                See full summary »

31.name: A Doll's House
31.description: Nora Helmer has years earlier committed a forgery in order to save the life of her authoritarian husband Torvald. Now she is being blackmailed lives in fear of her husband's finding out and...                See full summary »

34.name: Blue Jeans
34.description: Perry Bascom comes to the town of Rising Sun, Indiana, to take charge of the sawmills which have for years been managed by his father's best friend, Col. Henry Clay Risener. His father's ...                See full summary »

35.name: Rapsodia satanica
35.description: A Faustian tale about an old woman who makes a pact with Mephisto to regain her youth, in return she must stay away from love. After the deal she meets two brothers who fall in love with her.

36.name: The Spirit of '76
36.description: Catherine Montour (Adda Gleason), a striking half-breed Indian princess, and mistress of King George III (Jack Cosgrove) aspires to become the first Queen of America when the revolution breaks out.

37.name: The Gunfighter
37.description: Cliff Hudspeth, the leader of a band of outlaws in Arizona, has won his place by the killing of notorious gun-bullies. At their headquarters, in the Gila Mountains, in consultation with "...                See full summary »

38.name: The Fall of the Romanoffs
38.description: A dramatization of the Russian revolution and the influence upon the Russian royal family of the famous "mad monk," Rasputin.

39.name: Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm
39.description: With her family in financial difficulties, Rebecca is sent to live with her two strict, unfeeling aunts, who do not appreciate the young girl's charm and energy. Rebecca must make new ...                See full summary »

40.name: Madame Du Barry
40.description: Jeanette (Theda Bara), unknown in Paris but of great beauty and wit, attracts the attention of Louis XV (Charles Clary) who expresses a desire to meet her to Jean Du Barry (Herschel Mayall)...                See full synopsis »

41.name: House of Cards
41.description: The Mannings are a professional couple--she's a doctor, he's a lawyer--who are so absorbed in their careers that they have little time for their young daughter Louise, who is basically left...                See full summary »

42.name: The Gulf Between
42.description: A young woman, who is the daughter of a sea captain, falls in love with a man from a rich family who does not approve of her.

43.name: Alexander den Store
43.description: Members of the upper class regularly frequent Alexander Nyberg's elegant establishment. Affairs of the heart and misunderstandings create the comedic scenarios that accompany the guests. Based on the Gustav Esmann play of the same name.

44.name: A Tale of Two Cities
44.description: Alcoholic lawyer Sydney Carton travels to Paris during the Reign of Terror to rescue French aristocrat Charles Darnay, husband of the woman he loves.

45.name: The Secret Man
45.description: Convict Cheyenne Harry escapes from prison in a garbage truck and boards a train, where he eludes capture with the help of passenger Henry Beaufort.

46.name: The Heart of Texas Ryan
46.description: Colonel William Ryan, a ranch owner, in the Lone Star State, has named his only daughter Texas. Jack Parker, a devil-may-care cowpuncher, loves only two things, one is his horse and the ...                See full summary »

47.name: The End of the Tour
47.description: Col. Jessup of Mayville does not waste any affection on his young wife, who finally runs away with a theatrical company, taking her son with her, but leaving her baby daughter. Later, she ...                See full summary »

48.name: Little Women
48.description: The lives and loves of four sisters during their pastor father's absence.

49.name: Lorelei of the Sea
49.description: In a fishing village situated in the South Seas lives Lorelei, a beautiful young girl with romantic dreams who believes she is the daughter of Paul, the seal hunter. One night, Lorelei ...                See full summary »

50.name: Revelj
50.description: Marianne is a foster child at her aunt. She is lively and has dramatic dreams and this is not appreciated.
